item.title: Grit box, 5th January
item.description:
Grit box hasen't been filled for serveral years. We would like it filled with grit. Its such a dangerous spot for accidents. The box is becoming a litter box.

item.title: Loose cardboard and packaging debris obstructing the road and pavement., 5th January
item.description:
Large pieces of packaging and other debris have been dumped on both the carriageway and the pavement. One piece is lying in the road, creating a hazard for vehicles and cyclists, and other packaging is blocking part of the pavement, and contains broken glads. The waste appears unsecured and has likely come from fly-tipping or improperly disposed packaging.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kellett Road, Brixton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Very icy pavement, 5th January
item.description:
Pavement in Station approach is very icy and dangerous. As commuters are back at work and need to walk up here to station, can someone please grit it. Thanks

item.title: Broken glass on pavement, 5th January
item.description:
Broken glass and multiple cigarette stubs scattered on pavement outside chemist, since before Christmas. This was reported last Tuesday and marked as sorted on Wednesday, unfortunately it is still there. The staff at the chemist could not care less.

item.title: Packed ice causing cars to slide and mount pavement. Already my brick wall has been struck by a hit and run., 5th January
item.description:
Ice on road, danger to life and property. School children use this road every day. My brick wall damaged by out of control vehicle, hit and run. I now have to have it repaired. On Sunday I reported as an emergency - so far no action.

item.title: Bin area Dunstall House service road, off Marmont Road. Both ends., 5th January
item.description:
It's the same every day. Bins overflowing, rubbish and flytipping everyday. People urinating around and in the mess. The other end is just the same and often worse with flytipping. The pools of urine and smell, especially in the summer is awful. There are rats running through the rubbish. It's worse when the binmen have been, they leave the rubbish all over the road. A huge thanks to the same man who diligently cleans these area everyday. Wading through pools of urine, open rubbish bags and who know what else. He does a fantastic job daily. The bin collection days have been increased, but not enough. Two bins is not enough for a block of flats. Please do something about this health hazard and view. Stop the constant urination at back Dunstall house. This has been the same for years and getting worse. Please let the council cleaner know how much we appreciate his work at Dunstall House. Please also let the residents know, throwing rubbish bags from the walkways above is dangerous and unpleasant. They miss the bis and splatter on the floor. Maybe fix the chutes.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Peckham High Street, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
